intro: Colysis evrardii, commonly known as the Everard's colysis, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its square, hairy stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its small, tubular flowers are typically purple or violet in color, arranged in whorls along the stem. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Colysis evrardii is considered a species of conservation concern.
